quote: Ignorance is darkness.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Ignorance is a knowledge illiteracy.
author: Toba Beta,  Master of Stupidity

quote: It is not ignorance but knowledge which is the mother of wonder.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: There are all kinds of ignorance in the world. Education, learning to read and write, doesn't necessarily give us knowledge. We have to learn to use our minds to see what is really happening.
author: Linda Leaming,  Married to Bhutan

quote: Ignorance is ultimately the worst enemy of a people who want to be free.
author: Jonathan Hennessey,  The United States Constitution: A Graphic Adaptation

quote: Ignorance, when voluntary, is criminal, and a man may be properly charged with that evil which he neglected or refused to learn how to prevent.
author: Samuel Johnson,  The History of Rasselas, Prince of Abissinia

quote: Ignorance is the parent of fear.
author: Herman Melville,  Moby-Dick; or, The Whale

quote: Education is a system of imposed ignorance.
author: Noam Chomsky,  Manufacturing Consent: The Political Economy of the Mass Media

quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: We live on an island surrounded by a sea of ignorance. As our island of knowledge grows, so does the shore of our ignorance.
author: John Archibald Wheeler

quote: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little, not those who know much, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science.
author: Charles Darwin,  The Descent of Man

quote: To be ignorant is to waste the talents you were born with. To be ignorant is to confine your life to a path no different than the generations before you
author: Linda Cardillo,  Across the Table

quote: Ignorance breeds monsters to fill up the vacancies of the soul that are unoccupied by the verities of knowledge.
author: Horace Mann

quote: To know you are ignorant is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

quote: The purpose of education is not to validate ignorance but to overcome it
author: Lawrence M. Krauss

quote: Only ignorance excuses stupidity
author: Nalini Singh,  Angels' Blood

quote: Only one who has learned much can fully appreciate his ignorance.
author: Louis L'Amour,  Education of a Wandering Man

quote: Admission of ignorance is often the first step in our education
author: Stephen R. Covey,  The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change

quote: Ignorance is hardly unusual, Miss Davar. The longer I live, the more I come to realize that it is the natural state of the human mind. There are many who will strive to defend its sanctity and then expect you to be impressed with their efforts.
author: Brandon Sanderson,  The Way of Kings

quote: Where ignorance lurks, so too do the frontiers of discovery and imagination
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: ... informed ignorance provides the natural state of mind for research scientists at the ever-shifting frontiers of knowledge. People who believe themselves ignorant of nothing have neither looked for, nor stumbled upon, the boundary between what is known and unknown in the cosmos.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson,  Origins: Fourteen Billion Years of Cosmic Evolution

quote: Education is the light in the darkness of ignorance.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Don`t allow ignorance to further enslave your destiny.
author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper

quote: The more we learn about the world, and the deeper our learning, the more conscious, specific, and articulate will be our knowledge of what we do not know; our knowledge of our ignorance. For this indeed, is the main source of our ignorance - the fact that our knowledge can be only finite, while our ignorance must necessarily be infinite.
author: Karl Popper

quote: Science is the topography of ignorance.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

quote: Education is a progressive discovery of our own ignorance.
author: Will Durant

quote: I have my own theory: ignorance is bliss. The less you know, the more confident you can be in tackling things.
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering Guide

quote: You know, everybody's ignorant, just on different subjects.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Ignorance is darkness. Knowledge is light. Wisdom is awaken spirit
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Everybody gets told to write about what they know. The trouble with many of us is that at the earlier stages of life we think we know everything- or to put it more usefully, we are often unaware of the scope and structure of our ignorance.
author: Thomas Pynchon,  Slow Learner: Early Stories

quote: The mark of your ignorance is the depth of your belief in injustice and tragedy. What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly.
author: Richard Bach

quote: Ignorance is not bliss. It is the kiss of death.
author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: Admission of ignorance is often the first step in our education.
author: Stephen R. Covey,  The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change

quote: The only thing more dangerous than ignorance is the pretense of intelligent ignorance. The former is teachable; the latter is not.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: Education: the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty.
author: Mark Twain

quote: New knowledge enhances an ever increasing sense of our own ignorance. The more we know, the more we know we don't know. Feynman called it 'the expanding frontier of ignorance'.
author: Matt Baldwin,  Snow rising

quote: Any formal attack on ignorance is bound to fail because the masses are always ready to defend their most precious possession - their ignorance.
author: Hendrik Willem van Loon

quote: There are genuine mysteries in the world that mark the limits of human knowing and thinking. Wisdom is fortified, not destroyed, by understanding its limitations. Ignorance does not make a fool as surely as self-deception.
author: Mortimer J. Adler,  How to Read a Book: The Classic Bestselling Guide to Reading Books and Accessing Information

quote: Mankind have a great aversion to intellectual labor; but even supposing knowledge to be easily attainable, more people would be content to be ignorant than would take even a little trouble to acquire it.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: I believe that ignorance is the root of all evil.And that no one knows the truth.
author: Molly Ivins

quote: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.
author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Teh Ching

quote: Avoidable human misery is more often caused not so much by stupidity as by ignorance, particularly our ignorance about ourselves.
author: Carl Sagan,  The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark

quote: Nobody can make you feel ignorant but youâ€”the you from before, the one who skipped school and slept in class. By you, of course, I mean me.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the best book I've ever written, and it still sucks

quote: Religion. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: All of us must cross the line between ignorance and insight many times before we truly understand.
author: David Hawkins

quote: It is in the admission of ignorance and the admission of uncertainty that there is a hope for the continuous motion of human beings in some direction that doesn't get confined, permanently blocked, as it has so many times before in various periods in the history of man.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quote: There are in fact two things, science and opinion; the former begets knowledge, the latter ignorance.
author: Hippocrates

quote: ... there is no shame in not knowing. The problem arises when irrational thought and attendant behavior fill the vacuum left by ignorance.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson,  The Sky Is Not the Limit: Adventures of an Urban Astrophysicist

quote: Neglect of mathematics work injury to all knowledge, since he who is ignorant of it cannot know the other sciences or things of this world. And what is worst, those who are thus ignorant are unable to perceive their own ignorance, and so do not seek a remedy.
author: Roger Bacon,  Mathematics

quote: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.
author: Socrates
